This is a 3-credit intensive course that combines SPAN 201 and SPAN 202.

Before registering the course, please complete Spanish Language Questionnaire to determine which course level to start: https://fhis.air.arts.ubc.ca/spanish-placement-questionnaire-tool/

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Title: "Hispanic Cultural Expressions" | Explore the multiple facets of Hispanic culture from a critical perspective. Through the examination of various genres (music, art, and film), you will analyze the cultural production of different historical periods and address fundamental issues such as collective identity, resistance, social movements and gender politics.
This course does not count towards Minor and Major in Spanish

See more information about the course: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/span222/

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

Language of instruction: Spanish

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Competence in expressing yourself in a wide range of contexts, also in written form; familiarity with contemporary Swedish culture. 
Cultural topics include: Sauna culture, the Swedes dream of a summer cottage (sommarstuga), the Swedish Education System, and how to prepare for a visit to Sweden and all the fun, weird traditions

Book: Rivstart, Chapters 14-16

Sample syllabus here. 

Interested in other courses within the Department of Central, Eastern and Northern European Studies? Click here.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Drafting for Theatre and Film Production. This course will be held in the computer lab Buchanan B125.
This course is restricted to majors, minors and honours students in the department of Theatre & Film. If you are not a student within the department, please consult the instructor for registration.

instances.text: THTR_V 211-001 - Drama: Forms and Ideas II

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
THTR 211 Drama: Forms and Ideas II

Following THTR 210, THTR 211 is the second part of a two-course series that explores dramatic forms and ideas across a range of geographical and historical theatre contexts. THTR 211 emphasizes plays with significant cultural currency and/or impact from 1850 to the present. As comprehensive coverage of drama in this vast period is not possible in this course context, plays have been selected to investigate critical terms and formal innovations specifically related to pioneers of modern drama and socially provocative theatre. The class will consider the particular challenges and opportunities of dramaturgical analysis: what analytical tools, sources of evidence, methodologies and theoretical debates drive the field?

NOTE: You must also register in a corresponding Discussion Section (D11, D12, or D13). If this section if FULL or BLOCKED please sign up for the corresponding wait list section. Once you have registered in the wait list there is no need to contact the department. Your registration will be switched to the parent section when space becomes available. Preference may be given to Majors, Minors, or Honours students in Theatre or Film. For more information about Department of Theatre and Film wait lists please visit: http://theatrefilm.ubc.ca/undergraduate/undergraduate-courses/how-to-wait-list-a-course/

Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
